forming: Orientation, testing, and dependence. Members of a team may be identifying boundaries of both interpersonal and task behavior.
norming: Often characterized by conflict and polarization around interpersonal issues, members may be experiencing resistance to group influence and task requirements in this stage.
storming: Group cohesiveness is beginning to develop, new standards are beginning to evolve, and in the task realm, intimate and personal opinions are expressed.
performing: Interpersonal structure becomes the tool of task activities. Roles become functional, and group energy is funneled into a task. Structural issues have been resolved, and the team can now become supportive of task performance.
adjourning: The termination of roles along with completion of the task. :(
